comment.author: 14170629@N08
comment._content: Stromboli was a chestnut gelding foaled in 1911, by Fair Play (sire of Man O' War) out of St. Priscilla. He won over 60 races between 1913 & 1918, including numerous major New York stakes races, for owner/breeder August Belmont Sr: www.tbhorsepedigree.com/library/horse/Stromboli.php The jockey was Clarence Turner (1893 - 1957): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_Turner_%28jockey%29 If this photo was taken the same day as others in this set, this would be right after their win in the 1915 Metropolitan Handicap, a race that is still a fixure at Belmont each May. For their efforts, they took home a winner's purse of $2,325; By contrast, the horse that won this year's Metropolitan Handicap was awarded $450,000. Chart for the race can be found here (scroll to race 4): kdl.kyvl.org/cgi/t/text/pageviewer-idx?c=drf1910s;cc=drf1...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you for your reseach spotboslow. The digital copy of the chart is especially great. We'll add some of that information to the record the next time we update.

comment.author: 14170629@N08
comment._content: My pleasure.  It's nice when one's stash of "useless knowledge" can be made less useless.   :)
